page.title: 12The Year 1985
page.content:
Today's Date - June 10th, 1985
Breakfast begins with toast and tea. Many appliances are used including a kettle, toaster and a cooker. To go shopping we use a car which is run on either petrol or diesel. The shops use computerised tills to find the total you must pay. In the house a buzzing sound is heard which is made by the telephone. We have already cordless telephones. A television is found in most houses, we have four channels:- BBC1, BBC2, ITV, Channel 4. WHAM! and Paul Young provide pop music among others. In our time few people have visited the moon or outer space. Our schools are just beginning to use computers. Football, rugby and cricket are a few of the games we play at school. We start school at 9am. and finish at 3.30pm.
